intro: Spryginia winkleri subsp. araneosa, commonly known as the spider lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale pink flowers that resemble spiderwebs, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, green berries that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a delicate and endangered species.
